itemDescription: Chairman of White Star shipping line

wikipedia_page.main: Joseph Bruce Ismay (; 12 December 1862– 17 October 1937) was an English businessman who served as chairman and managing director of the White Star Line. In 1912, he came to international attention as the highest-ranking White Star official to survive the sinking of the company's new flagship RMS Titanic, for which he was subject to severe criticism.
